title: Ukraine war: History is rewritten for children in occupied areas
description: Teachers tell the BBC they are being pressured to teach according to Russia's version of history.

title: Abortion pill: Why Japanese women will need their partner's consent to get a tablet
description: Japan has a history of being extremely slow to approve drugs related to women's reproductive health.

title: The pilot who defected to the Taliban in his Black Hawk
description: As the Taliban retook Afghanistan, one elite pilot joined the militants he'd been trained to fight.

title: Girl raped aged 13 faces three-year wait for trial
description: The girl's father has described the "nightmare" of having the case postponed with just a few days' notice.

title: Meet Conservative members choosing the next PM
description: The BBC spoke to party members in Norwich who will vote for the next leader and UK prime minister.

title: Young Thug: How rap lyrics put a rapper behind bars
description: Prosecutors sometimes use lyrics to help charge artists with crimes, but rappers say it is racist and wrong.

title: Everton: Anthony Gordon transfer deadline has passed, says Frank Lampard
description: Everton boss Frank Lampard says the deadline for which he would consider selling winger Anthony Gordon had now passed.

title: When Mikhail Gorbachev visited Margaret Thatcher in Downing Street
description: Former prime minister, Margaret Thatcher called their 1989 meeting "deep" and "very friendly".

title: Mikhail Gorbachev: The Soviet leader who helped end the Cold War
description: His efforts to democratise his country led to the fall of communism, the end of the Cold War and the break-up of the Eastern Bloc.

title: Shamima Begum: Spy for Canada smuggled schoolgirl to Syria
description: Mohammed Al Rasheed says he shared her passport details with Canada as UK police hunted for her.

title: The Hundred: London Spirit v Birmingham Phoenix - Plays of the day
description: Watch the best of Tuesday's Hundred action as London Spirit hosted Birmingham Phoenix at Lord's.

title: Nick Robinson: Public want their leaders interviewed
description: As Liz Truss calls off her sit-down interview, the BBC journalist says in-depth questioning is still needed.

title: Melisa Raouf: Going make-up free in the Miss England final
description: Melisa Raouf is the first contender in the pageant's 94-year history to go bare-faced in the final.

title: Ukraine: What are Himars missiles and are they changing the war?
description: Ukraine says the US-made Himars missile system is changing the course of the war against Russia.

title: Antony: Manchester United agree to sign Ajax winger for £81.3m
description: Manchester United reach an agreement to sign Brazil winger Antony from Ajax for an initial fee of £81.3m - the joint-fourth most expensive signing in Premier League history.

title: Iraq: At least 23 dead amid fighting after Moqtada al-Sadr quits
description: Powerful Shia cleric Moqtada al-Sadr apologises to Iraqis, as clashes leave at least 23 people dead.

title: Meghan interview: We upset Royal dynamic just by existing, says Duchess of Sussex
description: In a wide-ranging interview the Duchess of Sussex talks about her life in the Royal Family.

title: Reading Festival 2022: Drone footage shows abandoned tents
description: The video of the aftermath of the Reading Festival shows the extent of the clear-up needed.

title: Notting Hill Carnival: Rapper Takayo Nembhard stabbed to death
description: Takayo Nembhard, also known as TKorStretch, was fatally stabbed at Carnival in west London.

title: Sebastian Suski earns world record for longest cucumber
description: If sliced up, the 3ft 8in (1.12m) whopper could make more than 400 cucumber sandwiches.

title: Pubs closure warning; 'My energy bill went to £35,000 from £13,000'
description: Six of the country's largest breweries warn pubs will have to close without help on energy costs.

title: BT and Openreach staff walk out in strike over pay
description: The Communication Workers Union said 40,000 members will stage two days of industrial action.

title: Pakistan floods are ‘a monsoon on steroids’, warns UN chief
description: A "climate catastrophe" has led to more than 1,100 deaths the UN says as it launches a big aid appeal.

title: Lurpak maker Arla warns dairy prices will remain high
description: The Ukraine war has pushed up feed, fertiliser and fuel costs for dairy farmers, the company says.

title: Ukraine grain deal: Where are the ships going?
description: More than 50 ships have braved the risks to take food from Ukraine to destinations around the world.

title: Truck spills 150,000 tomatoes causing California crash
description: Four people are injured after a truck overturns across a major motorway causing seven cars to crash.

title: Claressa Shields v Savannah Marshall: Briton says 2012 win eats away at rival
description: WBO world champion Savannah Marshall thinks her win over Claressa Shields ten years ago must "eat away" at her rival before their undisputed middleweight clash on 10 September.

title: Where are hosepipe bans in place and how can I save water?
description: Hosepipe bans are in place across much of England and parts of Wales.

title: World Gravy Wrestling Championships returns after two-year break
description: Organisers of the World Gravy Wrestling Championships say it is "amazing to be back".

title: Drought declared across South West England
description: The Environment Agency says the region is experiencing some of its driest conditions in 90 years.

title: World's loneliest man: Rare footage of him in the Amazon
description: Footage of a tribesman, who was the last survivor of an indigenous group in Brazil, shows him cutting down trees.

title: Scott Parker: Bournemouth sack head coach after 9-0 defeat by Liverpool
description: Bournemouth sack head coach Scott Parker three days after Saturday's 9-0 Premier League defeat at Liverpool.

title: Enagh Lough: Two teenage boys drown after getting into difficulty
description: The 16 year olds got into difficulty in Enagh Lough in Londonderry on Monday night.

title: Major clear-up under way in Edinburgh after bin strike
description: The walkout in the capital ended at 04:59 as rubbish continues to pile up in other council areas.

title: Dolphin nursery pod spotted from Thurso shop car park
description: The group of Risso's dolphins seen from the Caithness coast at Thurso included adults and juveniles.

title: Ecuador fears Galapagos tortoises were hunted and eaten
description: Ecuador has launched an investigation after remains of four of the protected animals were found.

title: Pole-dancing axe thrower wins world title
description: Ceola McGowan, from Sligo, cites pole dancing for improving her balance and strengthening her core.

title: Sarah Beeny: TV presenter reveals she has breast cancer
description: The 50-year-old is having treatment for breast cancer, the same disease that killed her mother.

title: Serena Williams: Will the US Open really be the end for the American great?
description: Serena Williams admits she has been "pretty vague" about her retirement plans, fuelling doubt about whether this year's US Open will be her final tournament.

title: Invergordon shed door marble bust could be sold
description: The sculpture of an 18th Century Highland laird was lost before being found on an industrial estate.

title: US Open: Serena Williams beats Danka Kovinic to extend New York farewell
description: Serena Williams extends her US Open farewell after a gritty opening win on an entertaining night packed with hope and celebration in New York.

title: US Open: Andy Murray wins New York opener, Harriet Dart shocks Daria Kasatkina
description: Britain's Andy Murray frustrates 24th seed Francisco Cerundolo to start the 10th anniversary of his US Open victory with a first-round win.

title: Unseen Charles Dickens letters show author's awareness of fame
description: In one he says he would be "so hampered" by post stopping on Sunday he threatens to move away.

title: Secret deals ending Britain's control in Gulf revealed
description: A BBC documentary shines a light on the collusions which ended Britain's empire in the Middle East.

title: Twin films: How two new Pinocchio movies reflect a Hollywood trend
description: It's the latest in a long line of two films coming out about the same subject in the same year.
